snippet: Abdelrahman al-Hamid, a founding member of the Saudi Association for Civil and Political Rights, was sentenced to nine years in jail. Abdelaziz al-Sinedi was sentenced to eight years in prison.
abstract: Saudi Arabia sentences Abdelrahman al-Hamid and Abdelaziz al-Sinedi to prison on charges stemming from their work as political and human rights activists.
lead_paragraph: Abdelrahman al-Hamid, a founding member of the Saudi Association for Civil and Political Rights, was sentenced to nine years in jail. Abdelaziz al-Sinedi was sentenced to eight years in prison.

headline.print_headline: Middle East; Saudi Arabia: 2 Activists Sentenced

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

keywords.value: Saudi Assn for Civil and Political Rights
